Content: My word of the next few months, Patience.

With BTC ETF flows surprising to the upside, the halving 2 months away, the STX Nakamoto upgrade coming in late April and the STX Bitcoin awareness marketing campaign ongoing, we continue to like STX and think it should outperform into what is a truly transformative upgrade.
Still believe ETH will eventually flip BTC. BTC has more long term structural concerns. Less clear to me whether it comes from ETH up or BTC down.

Interesting times ahead, think for yourself, don’t listen to others. Be careful, good luck.

Was planning to post this tomorrow but it seems the market is in fast mode at the moment so I'll share some thoughts now. Some of the below overlaps with my earlier ETHBTC post, but with the first Dencun testnet now slated for mid-January and mainnet targeting a Feb launch it…

Does anyone know why Celsius seems to be converting Crypto assets to fiat? My understanding of their plan was that all distributions, and seeding of a potential NewCo would be in kind. So in this context I’m not sure why they appear to be selling (can be seem on chain).
Looking forward to this. Will be a key milestone to monitor as we approach the upgrade.
Seems there is no adverse tax consequence on GS therefore the cash create issue may not impede their conversion.

Agree with James take here. The fact that after the first year it can be taxed as long term cap gains makes this not a huge deal. In net, I don't think this meaningfully changes the ETF impact and think most significant impact is that it may make Grayscale wait to convert.
This is interesting. Still want to see it officially announced but Eric hasn’t gotten much wrong…

Have exited all long Grayscale trust positions. Grayscale is not going to want to convert in a cash convert only scenario as their product will be very tax inefficient due to the low cost basis of their BTC and will therefore very possibly not convert with the first round of…

My guess on the net effect here is that it will cause some people to avoid allocating on the initial product launch as they may already have wanted to wait to see how things settled out and now have added incentive to wait for a more tax efficient product.

This was my concern. The rally from 25k to 42k was predominantly caused by an ETF that is now likely not going to be as attractive as holding spot BTC. It's unclear how large the magnitude of the impact is here but it's definitely relevant.

This issue of cash vs in-kind create/redeem for the ETF could potentially be relevant. Seems the SEC is dug in on only allowing cash creation which would make the spot ETF less tax efficient. Investors would be taxed on a portion of their gains regardless of whether they sell or…

As a separate point adding on to my earlier post, think it's a fairly good bet that MSTR's premium compresses post ETF. Currently it trades at ~40% premium. Think this trends closer to 0, and potentially negative, post ETF. Will have more detailed thoughts on this later. https://t.co/p7NsHHYnKA
